definition: more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: The century was in full flood of invention.
sentences.chinese: 這一世紀有層出不窮的創造發明。

sentences.english: New type viruses appear continuously because the nature is revenged on humans for air pollution.
sentences.chinese: 新型病毒層出不窮是自然對人類污染空氣的報復。

sentences.english: Also, much more classes of attack against the QKD system have emerged.
sentences.chinese: 各種針對密鑰分發系統的攻擊方案也層出不窮。

sentences.english: Looking at the domestic furnishings industry, product category after another, a variety of styles.
sentences.chinese: 放眼國內家飾行業，產品種類層出不窮，風格多樣。

sentences.english: Why is there never a shortage of counterfeit and poor quality products in China?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼假冒僞劣的產品在中國層出不窮？

sentences.english: At present, the encryption technology is maturer and maturer, and new algorithm is created every day.
sentences.chinese: 當前的加密技術日趨成熟，加密算法層出不窮。

sentences.english: I've seen hundreds of misapplications and confusions spouted throughout the web and in print.
sentences.chinese: 網上和出版物中的濫用和混淆層出不窮。

sentences.english: With their unending fascination for new ideas, Geminis and Sagittarians will never get bored of one another.
sentences.chinese: 他們層出不窮的新點子使他們彼此從不會感到厭倦。

sentences.english: Numerous such stories exist, but a reliable testing method does not.
sentences.chinese: 此類案例層出不窮，但卻沒有可行地試驗方法。

definition: to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to be related/to entail/to involve/joint (liability etc)
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
